page.title: 01Local History
page.content: In 1086 Cheriton Bishop appeared as "CERITONA", possibly from CYRIG-Church and TON-Farm. In the 13th Century "Bishop" was added. Medland Manor was also mentioned in Domesday Book. It is one of the few parishes in England still retaining unchanged its Saxon boundaries. The Parish Church has a Norman font in wheatsheaf style, the chancel dates from the 13th Century. The nave and tower are 15th Century and there is a ring of 6 bells. Part of the medieval rood screen, with its original paintings remains. The north aisle pews are also 15th Century. A rare painted achievement of Elizabeth 1st Royal Arms hangs over the south door. By Mrs N Grist
